author: bjh
msg: OS/2: Bypass EMX library's socket code and go straight to the OS/2 TCP/IP
stack. This should be more efficient and prevents handle collisions when using
native file API calls. This also means that file I/O calls (read()/write()
etc) can no longer be used on sockets.

author: bjh
msg: OS/2: Return error status when something goes wrong in ap_send()/ap_recv().
This will probably be needed on other platforms as well.

author: bjh
msg: Add new APR function ap_sendv(), a writev for APR sockets.

author: bjh
msg: OS/2: Put support for detached processes back into ap_create_process(),
